Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.app.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputEventListener
public class GameController extends Object implements InputEventListener
Controls the main game Logic and acts as the bridge between UI and game Logic. It handles input events and updates the game state accordingly.
Author:
Abdullah Usmani

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(GuiController c, GameMode mode)
      Constructs a new GameController with the specified Game Mode. Initializes the board, event listener, and game view.
      Parameters:
      c - The GuiController instance responsible for rendering.
      mode - The selected GameMode (CLASSIC or DIG).

  • Method Details

    • getScore

      public Score getScore()
      Retrieves the current Score object associated with the game board.
      Returns:
      The Score object containing the current score and high score.

    • onDownEvent

      public DownData onDownEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Handles the 'Down' event, which can be triggered by user input or the game loop (gravity). Moves the brick down if possible; otherwise, merges the brick to the background, checks for cleared rows, plays sound effects, and spawns a new brick.
      Specified by:
      onDownEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - The MoveEvent containing the source of the event (USER or THREAD).
      Returns:
      A DownData object containing information about cleared rows and the current view data.

    • onLeftEvent

      public ViewData onLeftEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Handles the 'Left' event triggered by user input. Attempts to move the current brick one unit to the left.
      Specified by:
      onLeftEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - The MoveEvent associated with the left movement.
      Returns:
      The updated ViewData reflecting the new position of the brick.

    • onRightEvent

      public ViewData onRightEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Handles the 'Right' event triggered by user input. Attempts to move the current brick one unit to the right.
      Specified by:
      onRightEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - The MoveEvent associated with the right movement.
      Returns:
      The updated ViewData reflecting the new position of the brick.

    • onRotateEvent

      public ViewData onRotateEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Handles the 'Rotate' event triggered by user input. Attempts to rotate the current brick counter-clockwise.
      Specified by:
      onRotateEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - The MoveEvent associated with the rotation.
      Returns:
      The updated ViewData reflecting the new orientation of the brick.

    • onHoldEvent

      public ViewData onHoldEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Handles the 'Hold' event triggered by user input. Swaps the current brick with the held brick or holds the current brick if the hold slot is empty.
      Specified by:
      onHoldEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - The MoveEvent associated with the hold action.
      Returns:
      The updated ViewData, typically reflecting the swapped or new brick.

    • onHardDropEvent

      public DownData onHardDropEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Handles the 'Hard Drop' event triggered by user input. Instantly moves the brick to the lowest possible position, calculates the score based on distance dropped, merges the brick, and checks for cleared rows.
      Specified by:
      onHardDropEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - The MoveEvent associated with the hard drop action.
      Returns:
      A DownData object containing information about cleared rows and the current view data.

    • createNewGame

      public void createNewGame()
      Resets the game state to start a new game. Clears the board, resets the score, and refreshes all UI components including the game background, next brick, and hold brick displays.
      Specified by:
      createNewGame in interface InputEventListener
